values: what is this quintissential dust of a man? holiday my lord. words, words words? cards my lord. The holidays are coming, and they're supposed to remind us of what's important. Presents, bills, snow tires, ice scrapers, though for you south-birds, just some rain and a pull over. What's important to you? really, truly important? However you answer that question, make sure you let your answer know how you feel.

Wow. So better be careful who you steal from. Granted this guy sat outside someone's house using a laptop in his car. At least do it discreetly.
ever get a bad itch on your ankle that's so bad you just cant stop scratching?

beach was great. no traffic except a little on the way back, as in, had to slow to 50mph once in a while. parking was 5$ and ample. we were the first two cars in the lot. special thanks goes to katherine and siobahn (did i spell that right) for making the beach day extra hilarious and/or fun. you best be takin care of those bubbles! EDIT: of course, the most thanks goes to Leah, for coming up with the idea of getting everyone together to go to the beach in the first place. <3 of course, my baby and i are burned so bad we can't even cuddle. punishment from the gods of ignorance, arrogance ("i don't need it on my legs," she says), and forgetfulness--especially my forgetfullness.

- 1.5 overeasy eggs (accidentally broke a yoke, spooned it out, poured over successful overeasy when almost done cooking)
- buttered pan toasted cinnamon bread
- pluot marmelade i made myself: knifed out the flesh of a pluot and diced it, added very little real maple syrup, served over the toast

http://nanocrew.net/?p=66 says members of a student group from which VLC came or of which is a member or something had some drunk fun one night, and brought home a cone. Then they collected them. Then they decided to dedicate their art in their great media player.

i haven't updated in a while either. i suppose the biggest news is my job. I got an offer from Grant Thornton, which I eventually accepted. I'm starting july 18th.

I got really sick the other day. Fever, chills, headache, unusual back pains, painful and contracted throat, urges to throw up. Mom said it was a cold. I thought it was punishment from Above because I convinced Leah to take a sick day. That's love.

Returned the dehumidifer I bought the other day at Home Depot. Sure it got rid of the humidity in the room, but it also *heated* it by about 15+ degrees. Not normal. Home depot guys were surprised to feel the box was still warm when I brought it in tonight. Maybe it really was defective. The eventual plan is an Energy Star a/c, but waltham and watertown were out of the model I wanted. On-line in-store pickup maybe?

Most of my symptoms are gone, but the throat and dizziness are still messed up. I'll get there.

in ways he saw, and ways he may never imagine. 

Jack Kilby, the inventor of the microchip passed away on June 20th, 2005. Texas Instruments, his employer when he created his masterpiece, has a nice online obituary for him.

http://www.ti.com/corp/docs/kilbyctr/jackstclair.shtml

"such is the power to change the world." --from the article.

TINY HARD DRIVES! As in, smaller than a pair of dice! I'm sure someone's already discovered these, but I'm still excited. LOOK HOW SMALL THEY ARE:


2 or 4 gigs thanks to Toshiba. Not the best in reliability in portable hard drives, but hey, they get 'em small. More here http://tinyurl.com/2zjho . *yes, a bad joke in reference to previous threats and posts recently.

and they posted in response to one of my posts about Intel's Yonah processor. Wow. Well I know it's not a real threat. Who would post that on my livejournal of all places? And the only lovely person I know with an H is Hannah. I hope it was her. I haven't talked to her in a long time, and what a conversation starter this would be.

The irony of this is that had someone like me "discovered" or "figured out" one of these Intel/Apple secrets, I don't think they'd come after me with ball-cutting. It'd probably be more in the form of them shrugging. I don't really predict much here. Usually I'm right on my hunches, but they aren't that far ahead in time or that prophetic considering how much information is already out there in the first place. Wait, that's not real irony. That's just rajinou.

The real irony is that one of my friends has a sister who has a myspace account that says she wished she had some balls to fulfill more of her life's dreams, and I was going to post something on her myspace about that, along the lines of, "are you sure you want them? they're not terribly useful."

http://www.appleinsider.com/article.php?id=1123 says Apple will take Yonah, a dual core version of Intel's latest mobile processor. A single core version is reportedly "in the works." What that really means is intel is just going to upgrade its existing Pentium M. Yonah will most likely include the EMT64 add-on the Pentium 4 got, which lets the processor be both 32 and 64 bit in order to handle OSX's 64-bit-ness.

fascinating captain. according to http://www.macrumors.com/pages/2005/06/20050620113113.shtml apple's going to have one soon. this isn't the first manufacturer's tip-off that's been correct. apple's shuffle came from news like this too, along with the ipod photo as well.

http://www.powerpage.org/cgi-bin/WebObjects/powerpage.woa/wa/story?newsID=14643

pictures of the Apple Developer Intel machine. It's an intel motherboard inside a G5 case.

I interviewed at Grant & Thornton yesterday for 2.5 hours. Long interviews are a good sign, as are the words "I'd really like to have you join our team" coming from a Grant & Thornton partner's mouth. I'm trying to remember that if this doesn't work out, I can always keep looking. Quietly excited, but hopes are keeping mellow.

you can see it on http://cis.bentley.edu . helped mark frydenberg set that up today. fun.

job dept: i'm still looking, but i have a bunch of leads out there. patti (my dad's new wife) gave me a lot of good feedback on fixing up my resume, although i haven't had enough time or energy to do all of the revisions today. i do need to do more before an interview i have on wed at 2pm. I'm excited about it. MaryAnn (CIS Chair at bentley) says I need to shave. I get to make myself look SPIFFY!

anyway, back to cleaning up the resume...

I got let go at Sun. It's really too bad, and that's all I can say. It came down to a financial constraint of my division... back to the job search drawing board. It's part of real life, real world, you know? So life goes on, and now I just need to find the next window that's open.

it's time for me to finally stop pretending things are all fine in my life. it's been stressful lately. i haven't been sleeping well for a handful of days now. everything's been hard on people close to me. I guess i kept things to myself because I didn't want to add to anyone's already difficult stress.

i'm not trying to get people to feel bad for me. i just needed to put these thoughts and feelings somewhere.

my dad got married on friday. just like the divorce, i thought it wouldn't bother me much, but it's finally catching up to me. i figured i could tell myself "it doesn't phase me, and this is what he wants, so he'll be happy." there were a lot of peculiarities that made the wedding difficult that i don't want to go into--for everyone involved, i'm giving them the benefit of the doubt: i doubt anything was done on purpose. how could my dad do anything on purpose anyway? he ALWAYS means well. he really does. and i love him for it. and i miss my dad.

the second thing is that my job at sun may not be so secure as everyone thought. this is especially troubling to me because i feel like i'm failing at the very core of how i was raised and what it means to be an asian american, as much or as little as i embrace my culture, i still strive so hard inside to do well just so my parents and my grand parents can be proud of me. and now i'm scared they can't. my manager wanted to give me a raise when he promoted me to Graduate Student Intern. this was great at first two weeks ago, but last Thursday I found out that someone in HR rejected the transaction. We still don't know if I'm going to get hired, but now it's shaky if I'm going to get to stay there at all. I also found out if I stay on as an Intern, I won't be allowed to work more than 19 hours/week due to a new policy. I feel like I should look for a new job; I feel like I'm going to get laid off--against both my manager, my operations manager, and my director's wishes... at least these people are working really hard, especially my manager, who is a wonderful human being and is working especially hard to get me to stay some how. I'm still scared though.

one good thing happened though. leah is moved into her apartment now. now we have our own space again. yay. i don't want to write any more. this entry is already long enough. best to all...

okonkwo was at costco today.

the weather has been making me so tired lately. tired and lazy. i watched some documentary films from leah's internship this afternoon with her, after our adventure at costco with my sister zoe. not much is happening at home now. i'm sleepy, leah is sleepier. she's napping. i'm gonna nerdzone for a bit. and then i think show her how to get to wilson's from my house and from waltham.

end communication.

P.S. I had a dream just now and I think you were in it Megan. I forget why though. I think you were there because you told me you didn't like strawberries, Oh wait no, I remembered that when Leah and I were eating strawberries. Which reminds me, actually this doesn't remind me, but adding to my entry from scrolling down so I can see my latest LJ Icon reminds me, Leah and I were really couple-dorks today, and told each other which pictures we like/dislike on our online things. Yes, nerds have maintenance.

...Bob Galliers and Alan Rickman are the same person!
Bob Galliers, Provost and VP Bentley College Alan Rickman, actor:
Marvin Robot and Snape

grad school in the fall, still at bentley. hurray! 

graduating was different. it felt like part of a to-do list, like a chore, more than a special event. lunch and dinner were nice, except when i felt like i was gonna explode.

i'm too lazy to write about much else. leah's temporarily moved into kevin's apartment, and we both can't wait until she moves into a real place... you know it's just that much less awkward you know?

anyway, it's back to simpsons and relaxing. monday i have a full day of work. and the gym.

http://www.uselessjunk.com/modules.php?name=News&file=article&sid=1890&mode=nested&order=0&thold=-1

in other news i beat star wars lego finally, and completely.

now i'm gonna go be a lazy graduate.
It came on Monday night, but I won't open it until Leah can have the first piece.

so now i'm really relaxed =)_~ and now i missed my baby.
lizz abby and i went out ot sorentos and it was a good time. yay wine. no yay for the weird waitress who looked like an alien from kamino, and whispering "you're welcome" in my ear. gross...

i think tonight i'm gonna relax and play lots of star wars lego. i've been trying to beat this one level completely. then i'll be really tired so i won't stay up too late tossing and turning.

then tomorrow i'll try to get my ass to a gym.

this weekend was pretty good. leah got a new chair for her apartment, and a new job. hurray for wilson farm.

i also turned in my last assignment as an undergraduate today. i'm doing grad in the fall, but it's still at bentley, so i don't feel like i'm gonna be going anywhere :)
i feel like i caught someone's insomnia

+= ?

x = ?

+ / = ?

 Best answers win a prize!

I still need to compile an appendix, but the rough draft of the body is done. 3:09 AM. 

Couldn't a done it without the pick me ups I had tonight. Thanks Leah, Becca, Lindsay, Lizz and of course, Beth. 

Cheers.

i had poor motivation all day, and i didn't get around to really getting into my paper until leah yelled at me (thank you sweetie) around midnight. the outline looks ok, and i just need to push out a couple pages per topic. i've got diagrams to throw in too, so i'll get length out of those too.

Gil came by today to meet Reagan. I think he's taking him next weekend. He's going to a better place, with more love. Reagan met Gil's baby, Gil junior, and loved him. My mom said he licked him and smelled him a lot, and the baby loved it. I'll miss you Reagan, but you're gonna have a lot of fun at your new family. Besides, I can visit once in a while too.

My eyes are tired, and so is my body. I also wish I could relive this morning. I've never woken up so warm and happy even if I didn't fall asleep until really late.
all i want right now is some wine, some simpsons, and some leah

so my mom called me a little while ago. the grand father of a friend of ours wants to take reagan. i told her ok, but only if they never give him to a pound. if they give him to a pound, i'll take him back. she said not to worry, they don't want to do that. this grandpa loves dogs, and gil, our friend, does too. i can also visit reagan whenever since he'll just be over in cambrdige, and i'll be in somerville.

i know some of you think this is irresponsible, ,but situation considered, i don't think it is. my mom doesn't have the time or the patience for reagan--she's not home; she's at work all week. i legally can't take him since the house i'm moving into doesn't allow dogs. the landlord might give eventually, but for the time being, i can only assume no dogs. 

I do want to meet the landlord and talk to her about this, but until then this is all i can assume.

the whole idea of our family getting a second dog was for peety to have company, but unfortunately that just didn't work. reagan was too big for peety, and they have dominance issues, but the worst problem is how much reagan likes to play and how lazy peety is. they argue about it. so assuming that for the time being i came up with another idea... ugh...

but before i get to that, i just had to deal with a frustrating phone call. Next Gen Realty is not a good company. Deposits for housing are legally defined as refundable until the lease is established. applications are signed for one purpose only: to apply for an apartment. not to sign a lease. they are separate agreements. apparently one real estate agent in particular, Jordan Conover, was exceptionally poor in service. he was not helpful or good at keeping us informed. he was flaky at best. for some reason he's no longer with the next gen office in allston. I actually just hung up on him. he kept blabbing on about the applications we signed. they are not legally binding. the lease is. anyway, i told him "it's your fault the apartment was off the market for two months. that is not our reponsibility, it is yours. and since we have not signed a lease, or lived in it, the deposit does not go toward rent payment. i expect a refund check. thank you." and i just hung up. i really don't want to turn it into a legal issue.

i need a beer... sapporo.

anyway, while i was in the shower, i remembered an awesome idea Leah had a while back about pets. Ferrets. They're not dogs. They're not cats, but they're not dogs. So I might get one of those. We'll see...

right now I just want my deposit back.

so we found a house. but it doesn't take dogs. maybe eventually, but not anytime soon. my mom doesn't want reagan. he tries my patience a lot too. he's just a puppy though. he should grow out of it. he's not even a year old yet. it's a good thing i'm so tired, or i'd be upset. i don't know what to do. i feel terrible sometimes, that i'm too busy to give him the love he deserves. he never means harm. how could he? he's lonely, and i know how that feels. i have to do a lot of thinking. and i'll talk it over with my mom.

what would I give for an amazing place to live?
it doesn't look good for reagan... 
i mean there's this amazing house we could have, but no dogs. maybe if she met him. he does like to chew, but only if he's out of his cage...
there's an apartment which is nice too that does allow dogs, but it doesn't have a back yard or free laundry (albeit laundry is onsite)

reagan is a bit of a pain. he's frustrating and annoying. sometimes i wish i could take peety instead. he's mellower than any pet i've known, but i don't know if i could work that out with my mom. maybe if i bought her a new dog instead.

peety pretty much is a cat that listens to you. he's so house trained, he doesn't make a mess. he's just a nice dog. doesn't even chew. he has no teeth! (well some, but not many) he likes to lick his toys if anything.

sigh
Cool isn't it? Finally tabs. Smiley smile makes smiles explode into chat window.

for some reason my aim account isn't working today. i was going to go out to dinner with my mom, sister, and my sister's exchange student, but it turned into a sister's friends only thing. so i'm at home, waiting for a casadilla to crunch up (yeah i know it's supposed to be soft, but i want crunchy) on a pan on the stove. i've been really tired and out of it a lot today, but the whole weekend was awesome, even though a lot of it involved painting leah's room. :P

I started looking at places for the summer. I'm not sure if I can do it because of my dog... he needs care just like a baby... :-\ 

Back to work? or something.

oh yeah I almost forgot, we saw Hitchhiker finally. It was GREAT. I loved the way they did the improbability drive. Especially when Arthur got nauseous. We also saw Upside of Anger with Megan and her boyfriend Jay. It was a cute chick flick, had its moments, twists, and I really liked Kevin Costner in it.

ok now back to work... i think.
my fucking ATI TV software didn't launch to record south park. complained something wasn't plugged in. plugged in my ass it was plugged in! back to work...

first of all, Leah, thanks so much for having me over. Second, holy crap was that food good. Though the gefilte (did I spell that right?) fish wasn't 100% Joan Schaffer (Leah's mom) authentic, it was still really good. I didn't expect it to be a sweet food, but mmmmm. I also got to read a paragraph from the uh "instruction manual"... haggadah, right? Leah and I both got really sleepy and relaxed off the Manischewitz. I guess we were loaded, but not in the crazy way. More like the "we can't sit up straight" way. Last night we watched "The Forgotten", which was pretty interesting/freaky, but not in a scary movie way. I was planning on coming home Sundee, but I've got a really sweet girl who won't send me home driving in the night (especially when it could've been raining like it was on the way there--eesh.)

I've finished Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy, and now I'm reading about the Restaurant at the End of the Universe. Which, I suspected might not have something to do with a spatial edge, but the other kind :)

I also got into a CRAZY physics conversation with Leah's dad and brother, and some family friends of theirs.

Oh yeah, and we installed tiger.

96 and change hours of coding and it's done.

now, it's time for the magic.

i've never had a canker sore that hurt this much before. there's actually four of them, but two are right along the ridge of my gumline behind my left lower molar and must be near or touching a nerve or two. i couldn't even speak just now. i had to put anesthetic in my mouth (god bless hurricaine (20% benzocaine) ). it stung when my pinky finger touched the canker, but i had to leave it there, rub it around, press, and it hurt so much i had to hold myself. i've bruised bones, had contusions, sinus headaches, migraines, twists, gas, but this was different. it burned inside along a nerve, and i felt it run up my jawline and to the back of my ear. after a few seconds it changed, and now it's gone. thanks to some hurricaine. and now it's back to work. 

i know. the cankers are from stress. it should all be over soon.

gotta get back into my geek groove.

caffine + humidity = bad
48 hours of coding and counting. a box of tissues and a roll of toilet paper and still sniffling. at this point i'd pick project over allergies.

this project is what hampster dance should have been about in the first place: some kid at cornell made a machine that makes midi music based on hampster movement.

http://instruct1.cit.cornell.edu/courses/eceprojectsland/STUDENTPROJ/2002to2003/lil2/

So I've been writing code for almost the entire afternoon/evening, except for a really nice break I got from watching the fireworks at Brandeis. The only weird part about it was the music that was playing. What was with the sap-rock? And Jazz Oh Christmas Tree? (Tannenbaum). 

This project is getting interesting, and this is my mental break before I tackle what I think is the trickiest part of my project. I feel like I should meditate first.

Thursday is the Shins concert, but there's plenty to do before it. It will be a good reward.

not really sure why i did that. just felt like it. i mean, it is funny to say.

my sisters and i aren't trying to kill each other, play solitary (confinement), or internment camp. my hair is flopped down too.


icons changing too. it's spring why not? the journal will change soon too. colors at least. the new 3 is nice, but that's not all i do--drool that is.

sincity was good, but my bed is still empty and cold tonight.

i haven't taken any valium in a while before bed, but i'm getting sick of crying myself to sleep.

ps mac users, don't forget software update. apple released 10.3.9 update.

just woke up from a nap. i was so tired, i didn't want to but i had no choice at some point and just fell asleep on the floor. i had a really weird dream, some of it too complicated to even remember, except for the part about flying. i could fly, and i liked that part. the colors were so vivid. woke up though. room's kinda chilly. back to work.

at least for a little while. i let peety out, but reagan slipped out because he's a sneaky bastard. *shakes head* i gave up. granted his emergency recall command worked, but i was too tired to lunge and grab him. so i gave up. i went inside and left the storm door closed. peety went to look through it. he started barking when reagan came back. i guess they've become better friends this past week since i let them play together, and reagan had a friend who was waiting for him to come back.

i came home to a house that was empty except for two dogs. i decided instead of feeling lonely i could try feeling useful: i went to the basement and got all of the energy saving bulbs and installed them everywhere i could, even the light fixtures that my mom didn't think they would fit in. i got them to fit. it just took some tinkering. it helped me get my mind of things and helped me feel like i could actually do something right, until i got to the last bulb.

I woke up late today, but I still managed to get most of everything done. Still got work work to do. I went to the bookstore for some goodies, and even grabbed a slice of pizza at Greg's in Belmont Center. I was surprised at myself, I mean I was hungry, but I also spent money on pizza by myself? Whatever, I had paper work to do while I was there! 

Lost is on tonight, and I'm grabbing dinner with my aunt because she thinks I'm gonna go insane by myself this week. My dogs would make me nuts, but hey, today they were so good! They played together, including some tricks on me that are a little hard to explain, but it involved doors and water. I'm not sure if they did it on purpose...
